Detailed Description

#define CVMX_DEBUG_BASIC_CONTEXT
Value:
F(remote_controlled);                       \
    {   int i;                                  \
        for (i = 0; i < 32; i++)                \
            F(regs[i]);                         \
    }                                           \
    {   int i;                                  \
        for (i = 0; i < 12; i++)                 \
            F(mpy_regs[i]);                         \
    }                                           \
    F(lo);                                      \
    F(hi);

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum cvmx_debug_comm_type_e
Enumerator:
COMM_UART 
COMM_REMOTE 
COMM_SIZE 
enum cvmx_debug_command_t
Enumerator:
COMMAND_NOT_CONTROLED 
COMMAND_NOP 

Core doesn't need to do anything.

Just stay in exception handler

COMMAND_STEP 

Core needs to perform a single instruction step.

COMMAND_CONTINUE 

Core need to start running.

Doesn't return until some debug event occurs

COMMAND_NOT_FOCUS 

The focus core changed.

Function Documentation

static int cvmx_debug_booted ( void   )  [inline, static]
void cvmx_debug_finish ( void   ) 

Inform debugger about the end of the program.

This is called from crt0 after all the C cleanup code finishes. Our current stack is the C one, not the debug exception stack.
